MetaPipe 0.0.1

Reference

All functions

assess_normality()

Assess normality of features

assess_normality_postprocessing()

Postprocessing for the normality assessmment of the features

assess_normality_stats()

Statistics for the normality assessmment of the features.

check_alpha()

Check significance level (alpha) validity

compare_hist()

This function generates a two histograms to compare two datasets

effect_plots()

Create effect plots for significant QTLS found with qtl_perm_test.

generate_hist()

This function generates a single histogram

ggplot_save()

Function to save a graphical object generated with GGPLOT2 to disk in Portable Network Graphics (PNG) format.

hex_logo()

Create Hexagonal logo for MetaPipe

is_pseudo_marker()

Verifies whether or not a string is a pseudo-marker, contains the substring 'loc'

load_raw()

Load raw data

log_transformation()

Normalise data with a log transformation

paretoscale()

Pareto scaling function This function is adapted from Stephen C. Grace and Dane A. Hudson

power_transformation()

Normalise data with a power transformation

qtl_perm_test()

Perform QTL mapping permutation test using scanone to obtain significant QTLs

qtl_scone()

Perform QTL mapping scanone to obtain LOD scores for all features and markers

random_genotypes()

Generate a pseudo-random list of genotypes. Particularly useful for testing.

random_map()

Generate a pseudo-random genetic map. Particularly useful for testing.

replace_missing()

Replace missing values (NAs)

root_transformation()

Normalise data with a root transformation

save_plot()

Function to save a graphical object to disk in Portable Network Graphics (PNG) format.

save_plotPDF()

Function to save a graphical object to disk in Portable Document Format (PDF) format.

save_plotTIFF()

Function to save a graphical object to disk in Tagged Image File Format (TIFF) format.

transform_data()

Normalise data using different methods: log, power, and root, with a different number of parameters to find out which one transforms the data into a normal-ish set.

transform_pseudo_marker()

Transforms a pseudo-marker to a standar marker by looking for the nearest one

Contents

Developed by Roberto Villegas-Diaz, Dilmini Alahakoon.
